00030 #include "util/Verbose.h"
00031 
00032 using namespace std;
00033 
00039 void Verbose::progressStep(int verbosity) {
00040   Param &p = getParam();
00041  
00042   assert(p.m_DotCount.size() > 0);
00043   assert(p.m_DotMod.size() > 0);
00044 
00045   if(verbosity <= p.m_Verbosity) {
00046     p.m_DotCount.back()--;
00047     /* Check to see if it is time to call the step report function yet. */
00048     for(unsigned int i = 0; i < p.m_ProHandler.size(); i++) {
00049       if(p.m_DotCount.back() <= 0 || p.m_ProHandler[i]->handleAll()) {
00050         p.m_ProHandler[i]->progressStep(verbosity);
00051       }
00052     }
00053     if(p.m_DotCount.back() <= 0) {
00054       p.m_DotCount.back() = p.m_DotMod.back(); // reset the counter
00055     }
00056   }
00057 }
00058 
00064 Verbose::Param &Verbose::getParam() {
00065 
00066   // Avoid weird windows .NET/Forms bug where linking to cout/cerr can cause problems...
00067 #ifdef _NO_STD_OUT
00068   static ProgressDot progHandler(0, NULL);
00069   static MsgStream  msgHandler(0, NULL);
00070 #else
00071   // Normal console mode is ok.
00072   static ProgressDot progHandler(1, &std::cerr);
00073   static MsgStream msgHandler(1, &std::cerr);
00074 #endif
00075 
00076   // By default we just use a normal message handler as the warning handler.
00077   static Verbose::Param m_Param(&progHandler, &msgHandler, &msgHandler);
00078   return m_Param;
00079 }
00080 
00082 void Verbose::pushProgressHandler(ProgressHandler *handler) {
00083   getParam().m_ProHandler.push_back(handler);
00084 }
00085 
00086 void Verbose::popProgressHandler() {
00087   getParam().m_ProHandler.pop_back();
00088 }

00091   getParam().m_MsgHandler.push_back(handler);

00094 void Verbose::popMsgHandler() {
00095   getParam().m_MsgHandler.pop_back();
00096 }

00098 void Verbose::pushWarnHandler(MsgHandler *handler) {
00099   getParam().m_WarnHandler.push_back(handler);
00100 }
00101 
00102 void Verbose::popWarnHandler() {
00103   getParam().m_WarnHandler.pop_back();
00104 }

00106 void Verbose::progressBegin(int verbosity, const std::string &msg, int total, int dotMod, int maxCalls) {
00107   std::vector<ProgressHandler *> &m_Handle = getParam().m_ProHandler;
00108   getParam().m_DotMod.push_back(dotMod);
00109   getParam().m_DotCount.push_back(0);
00110   // if we have handlers let them know we're beginning.
00111   for(unsigned int i = 0; i < m_Handle.size(); i++) {
00112     ProgressHandler *handle = m_Handle[i];
00113     if(handle->handleAll()) 
00114       handle->progressBegin(verbosity, msg, maxCalls);
00115     else
00116       handle->progressBegin(verbosity, msg, total);
00117   }
00118 }
00119 
00120 
00121 void Verbose::progressEnd(int verbosity, const std::string &msg) {
00122   Verbose::Param &p = getParam();
00123 
00124   assert(p.m_DotCount.size() > 0);
00125   assert(p.m_DotMod.size() > 0);
00126 
00127   p.m_DotMod.pop_back();
00128   p.m_DotCount.pop_back();
00129   if(verbosity <= p.m_Verbosity) {
00130     for(unsigned int i = 0; i < p.m_ProHandler.size(); i++) {
00131       p.m_ProHandler[i]->progressEnd(verbosity, msg);
00132     }
00133   }
00134 }
00135 
00142 void Verbose::setOutput(bool output) {
00143   Verbose::Param &p = getParam();
00144   p.m_Output = output;
00145 }
00146 
00152 void Verbose::setLevel(int level) {
00153   Verbose::Param &p = getParam();
00154   for(unsigned int i = 0; i < p.m_ProHandler.size(); i++) {
00155     p.m_ProHandler[i]->setBaseVerbosity(level);
00156   }
00157   for(unsigned int i = 0; i < p.m_MsgHandler.size(); i++) {
00158     p.m_MsgHandler[i]->setBaseVerbosity(level);
00159   }
00160 }
00161 
00168 void Verbose::out(int level, const std::string &s, bool nl) {
00169   Verbose::Param &p = getParam();
00170   if(p.m_Output) {
00171       for(unsigned int i = 0; i < p.m_MsgHandler.size(); i++) {
00172           p.m_MsgHandler[i]->message(level, s, nl);
00173       }
00174   }
00175 }
00176 
00183 void Verbose::warn(int level, const std::string &s, bool nl, const std::string prefix) {
00184   Verbose::Param &p = getParam();
00185   if(p.m_Output) {
00186       for(unsigned int i = 0; i < p.m_WarnHandler.size(); i++) {
00187           p.m_WarnHandler[i]->message(level, prefix + s, nl);
00188       }
00189   }
00190 }
